articles.title: Apple just made Xcode better for vibe coding
articles.description: Apple has just released Xcode 26.3 , and it's a big step forward in terms of the company's support of coding agents. The new release expands on the AI features the company introduced with Xcode 26 at WWDC 2025 to give systems like Claude and ChatGPT more robust access to its in-house IDE. Wi
articles.content: Apple has just released Xcode 26.3 , and it's a big step forward in terms of the company's support of coding agents. The new release expands on the AI features the company introduced with Xcode 26 at WWDC 2025 to give systems like Claude and ChatGPT more robust access to its in-house IDE. With the update, Apple says Claude and OpenAI's Codex "can search documentation, explore file structures, update project settings, and verify their work visually by capturing Xcode Previews and iter
articles.author: Igor Bonifacic

articles.title: Apple’s Xcode adds OpenAI and Anthropic’s coding agents
articles.description: Apple is building OpenAI and Anthropic's AI-powered coding agents directly into Xcode. New integrations in Xcode 26.3 will give developers the ability to call upon Anthropic's Claude Agent and OpenAI's Codex to write and edit code, update project settings, search documentation, and more. Xcode is th
articles.content: Apple is building OpenAI and Anthropic's AI-powered coding agents directly into Xcode. New integrations in Xcode 26.3 will give developers the ability to call upon Anthropic's Claude Agent and OpenAI's Codex to write and edit code, update project settings, search documentation, and more. Xcode is the software developers can use to create and test apps for the iPhone, Mac, iPad, Apple Watch, and Apple TV. Both Claude and ChatGPT were previously available inside Xcode, but this latest update will
articles.author: Emma Roth

articles.title: Agentic coding comes to Apple’s Xcode with agents from Anthropic and OpenAI
articles.description: Xcode 26.3 offers agentic coding capabilities with Anthropic's Claude Agent and OpenAI's Codex.
articles.content: Xcode 26.3 offers agentic coding capabilities with Anthropic's Claude Agent and OpenAI's Codex.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Xcode 26.3 adds support for Claude, Codex, and other agentic tools via MCP
articles.description: With Model Context Protocol (MCP), this works with more than Codex/Claude, too.
articles.content: Apple has announced a new version of Xcode, the latest version of its integrated development environment (IDE) for building software for its own platforms, like the iPhone and Mac. The key feature of 26.3 is support for full-fledged agentic coding tools, like OpenAI's Codex or Claude Agent, with a side panel interface for assigning tasks to agents with prompts and tracking their progress and changes. This is achieved via Model Context Protocol (MCP), an open protocol that lets AI agents work wit
articles.author: Samuel Axon

articles.title: How to maximize GitHub Copilot’s agentic capabilities
articles.description: A senior engineer's guide to architecting and extending Copilot's real-world applications. The post How to maximize GitHub Copilot’s agentic capabilities appeared first on The GitHub Blog .
articles.content: Modern engineering work rarely lives in a single file. Real systems evolve across years of incrementally layered decisions—some good, some accidental. A single feature request (“Add tagging to notes,” “Refactor the validation layer,” “Support a new consumer on our API”) often touches controllers, domain models, repositories, migrations, tests, documentation, and deployment strategy. Copilot’s agentic capabilities don’t replace your judgment i
articles.author: Ari LiVigni

articles.description: Two agents involved in the shooting deaths of US citizens in Minneapolis are reportedly part of highly militarized DHS units whose extreme tactics are generally reserved for war zones.

articles.title: Microbes could extract the metal needed for cleantech
articles.description: In a pine forest on Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, the only active nickel mine in the US is nearing the end of its life. At a time when carmakers want the metal for electric-vehicle batteries, nickel concentration at Eagle Mine is falling and could soon drop too low to warrant digging. But earlier this
articles.content: In a pine forest on Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, the only active nickel mine in the US is nearing the end of its life. At a time when carmakers want the metal for electric-vehicle batteries, nickel concentration at Eagle Mine is falling and could soon drop too low to warrant digging. But earlier this year, the mine’s owner started testing a new process that could eke out a bit more nickel. In a pair of shipping containers recently installed at the mine’s mill, a fermentation-derived broth develop
articles.author: Matt Blois

articles.title: What’s new at Stack Overflow: February 2026
articles.description: This month, we’ve launched several improvements to AI Assist, opened Chat to all users on Stack Overflow, launched custom badges across the network, and launched one of the first community-authored coding challenges.
articles.content: This month, we’ve launched several improvements to AI Assist, opened Chat to all users on Stack Overflow, launched custom badges across the network, and launched one of the first community-authored coding challenges.

articles.title: What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built
articles.description: What languages are growing fastest, and why? What about the projects that people are interested in the most? Where are new developers cutting their teeth? Let’s take a look at Octoverse data to find out. The post What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built appeared first
articles.content: In 2025, software development crossed a quiet threshold. In our latest Octoverse report , we found that the fastest-growing languages, tools, and open source projects on GitHub are no longer about shipping more code. Instead, they’re about reducing friction in a world where AI is helping developers build more, faster. By looking at some of the areas of fastest growth over the past year, we can see how developers are adapting through: The programming languages that are growing most in AI-as
articles.author: Dylan Birtolo

articles.title: Stop Streaming Plain Text: Unlock Interactive UIs with React Server Components
articles.description: You've mastered streaming text. The AI types, the user reads, and the magic of perceived performance is achieved. But what if the AI could do more than just tell ? What if it could show and let you interact ? Welcome to the paradigm shift. We are moving Beyond Text . In this guide, we’ll explore how
articles.content: You've mastered streaming text. The AI types, the user reads, and the magic of perceived performance is achieved. But what if the AI could do more than just tell ? What if it could show and let you interact ? Welcome to the paradigm shift. We are moving Beyond Text . In this guide, we’ll explore how to stream actual React components directly from the server to the client. Using the Vercel AI SDK and React Server Components (RSCs), we'll transform a static chat interface into a dynamic, interacti
articles.author: Programming Central

articles.description: Frontend Quality Gates See also: Backend Quality Gates Backend linters catch async footguns. Type checkers prevent runtime explosions. Now the frontend's turn. JavaScript fails silently. That's the whole problem in one sentence. You call a function with the wrong arguments. It runs. You access a pro
articles.content: Frontend Quality Gates See also: Backend Quality Gates Backend linters catch async footguns. Type checkers prevent runtime explosions. Now the frontend's turn. JavaScript fails silently. That's the whole problem in one sentence. You call a function with the wrong arguments. It runs. You access a property that doesn't exist. It runs. You forget to handle null. It runs. Everything runs. Nothing works. Users complain. You have no idea why. This is fine. Everything is fine. Just kidding. This is cha
articles.author: nicolas.vbgh

articles.title: Sony's WH-1000XM6 headphones are down to a record-low price
articles.description: Sony's wireless WH-1000XM6 headphones are on sale for $398 via Amazon . This is a record-low price, as it drops $62 from the price tag. The sale applies to all three colorways. These easily topped our list of the best wireless headphones . They are, in a word, fantastic. The headphones are packe
articles.content: Sony's wireless WH-1000XM6 headphones are on sale for $398 via Amazon . This is a record-low price, as it drops $62 from the price tag. The sale applies to all three colorways. These easily topped our list of the best wireless headphones . They are, in a word, fantastic. The headphones are packed with premium features , like advanced ANC. There are a whopping 12 ANC microphones throughout and a brand-new chip to power the feature. The end result? It successfully blocks background noise at me
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

articles.title: What we’ve been getting wrong about AI’s truth crisis
articles.description: This story originally appeared in The Algorithm, our weekly newsletter on AI. To get stories like this in your inbox first, sign up here. What would it take to convince you that the era of truth decay we were long warned about—where AI content dupes us, shapes our beliefs even when we catch the
articles.content: This story originally appeared in The Algorithm, our weekly newsletter on AI. To get stories like this in your inbox first, sign up here . What would it take to convince you that the era of truth decay we were long warned about—where AI content dupes us, shapes our beliefs even when we catch the lie, and erodes societal trust in the process—is now here? A story I published last week pushed me over the edge. It also made me realize that the tools we were sold as a cure for this crisis are failing
articles.author: James O'Donnell

articles.title: The best deals on MacBooks right now
articles.description: Apple currently sells MacBooks equipped with its own M-series processors in a wide range of sizes and price points, all of which run the company’s newest operating system, macOS 26. Purchasing a new MacBook can be complicated if you’re trying to figure out what specs you need, but finding a deal on
articles.content: Apple currently sells MacBooks equipped with its own M-series processors in a wide range of sizes and price points, all of which run the company’s newest operating system, macOS 26 . Purchasing a new MacBook can be complicated if you’re trying to figure out what specs you need, but finding a deal on a relatively speedy model is surprisingly easy, especially since Apple increased the starting RAM on several models in late 2024 and hasn’t stopped. These days, it’s not uncommon to see various MacBo
articles.author: Cameron Faulkner

articles.title: Microsoft says it’s building an app store for AI content licensing
articles.description: Microsoft says it is working on the Publisher Content Marketplace (PCM), an AI licensing hub that shows usage terms set by publishers. That way, AI companies can easily shop the terms and set up deals to use online content for "grounding" their AI models, while the content owners get usage-based rep
articles.content: Microsoft says it is working on the Publisher Content Marketplace (PCM), an AI licensing hub that shows usage terms set by publishers. That way, AI companies can easily shop the terms and set up deals to use online content for "grounding" their AI models, while the content owners get usage-based reporting to help set prices. Microsoft says it's been codesigning PCM with companies including Verge parent Vox Media, The Associated Press, Condé Nast, People, and others. The AI boom has been l
articles.author: Emma Roth

articles.title: Ridge Regression vs Lasso Regression
articles.description: Introduction Linear regression stands as one of the most fundamental tools in a data scientist's toolkit. At its core lies Ordinary Least Squares (OLS), a method that estimates model parameters by minimizing the sum of squared differences between predicted and actual values. In many real world probl
articles.content: Introduction Linear regression stands as one of the most fundamental tools in a data scientist's toolkit. At its core lies Ordinary Least Squares (OLS), a method that estimates model parameters by minimizing the sum of squared differences between predicted and actual values. In many real world problems, such as house price prediction datasets often contain many features, correlated variables, and noisy inputs. In such cases, traditional Ordinary Least Squares (OLS) regression becomes unstable an
articles.author: Maureen Muthoni

articles.title: Fitbit founders launch Luffu, a way to integrate your family's health data
articles.description: Fitbit's founders have a new startup. Two years after leaving Google , James Park and Eric Friedman announced a new platform that shifts the focus from the individual to the family. They say the Luffu mobile app "uses AI quietly in the background" to collect and organize family health informatio
articles.content: Fitbit's founders have a new startup. Two years after leaving Google , James Park and Eric Friedman announced a new platform that shifts the focus from the individual to the family. They say the Luffu mobile app "uses AI quietly in the background" to collect and organize family health information. "At Fitbit, we focused on personal health — but after Fitbit, health for me became bigger than just thinking about myself," Park said in a press release. The app is particularly focused on the "CEO
articles.author: Will Shanklin

articles.title: French police raid X’s Paris office as UK investigation continues
articles.description: A raid on X's Paris office was carried out by the Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit on Tuesday with Europol and French police as part of an ongoing investigation that expanded in July to include Grok. As previously reported by Reuters, Elon Musk and former X CEO Linda Yaccarino were also summoned f
articles.content: A raid on X's Paris office was carried out by the Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit on Tuesday with Europol and French police as part of an ongoing investigation that expanded in July to include Grok. As previously reported by Reuters , Elon Musk and former X CEO Linda Yaccarino were also summoned for hearings in April. The investigation, which was initially launched last year , is looking into several allegations against X and Grok, including complicity in possession and distribution of child
articles.author: Stevie Bonifield

articles.title: Obsidian has no plans to make The Outer Worlds 3, likely due to poor sales
articles.description: Developer Obsidian recently announced that it currently has no plans to make The Outer Worlds 3 , according to a report by Bloomberg . Company head Fergus Urquhart didn't give a reason as to why Obsidian won't be working on a sequel, but he did note that the performance of The Outer Worlds 2
articles.content: Developer Obsidian recently announced that it currently has no plans to make The Outer Worlds 3 , according to a report by Bloomberg . Company head Fergus Urquhart didn't give a reason as to why Obsidian won't be working on a sequel, but he did note that the performance of The Outer Worlds 2 was "disappointing" and that it needs to "think a lot about how much we put into the games, how much we spend on them and how long they take." Urquhart also said that Avowed was something of a miss f
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

articles.title: Original Nintendo Switch passes the DS to become Nintendo's bestselling console
articles.description: Switch 2 has already beaten the Wii U and is on its way to overtaking GameCube.
articles.content: Though it was finally replaced last year by the new Switch 2, the orginal switch isn't done just yet. Many recent Switch games (and a handful of major updates, like the one for Animal Crossing ) have been released in both Switch and Switch 2 editions, and Nintendo continues to sell all editions of the original console as entry-level systems for those who can't pay $450 for a Switch 2. The nine-year-old Switch's continued availability has helped it clear a milestone, according to the company's th
articles.author: Andrew Cunningham

articles.title: Google court filings suggest ChromeOS has an expiration date
articles.description: ChromeOS may be canned once the current support guarantee has run its course.
articles.content: Chromebooks debuted 16 years ago with the limited release of Google's Cr-48 , an unassuming compact laptop that was provided free to select users. From there, Chromebooks became one of the most popular budget computing options and a common fixture in schools and businesses. According to some newly uncovered court documents, Google's shift to Android PCs means Chromebooks have an expiration date in 2034. The documents were filed as part of Google's long-running search antitrust case, which began
articles.author: Ryan Whitwam

articles.title: Republicans Are All In on Boosting Fraud Allegations in California
articles.description: Right-wing influencers who were instrumental in spreading allegations of fraud in Minnesota ahead of ICE’s surge are now going after a number of California’s social welfare programs.

articles.title: Wing Commander III: "Isn't that the guy from Star Wars?"
articles.description: C:\ArsGames looks at a vanguard of the multimedia FMV future that never quite came to pass.
articles.content: It's Christmas of 1994, and I am 16 years old. Sitting on the table in our family room next to a pile of cow-spotted boxes is the most incredible thing in the world: a brand-new Gateway 66MHz Pentium tower, with a 540MB hard disk drive, 8MB of RAM, and, most importantly, a CD-ROM drive. I am agog, practically trembling with barely suppressed joy, my bored Gen-X teenager mask threatening to slip and let actual feelings out. My life was about to change—at least where games were concerned. I'd been
articles.author: Lee Hutchinson
